column5: Now that I have your attention...lol.  Just wondered if anyone has had success fishing Okeechobee?  My buddy just offered me a 12 day trip, staying at his grandparents place, to fish Okeechobee from March 18-29.  We will be launching out of Clewiston, and running in his 21ft Ranger with 225. So anywhere on the Lake is fish-able.  Obviously the lake is pretty weed-choked, but just wondering if anyone has found a certain technique(s) seem to outproduce others?  Cheers, *Stoty
Stoty, you must have hit the money tree somewhere...  new boat, now vacation!!  you da man!!!
hahaha....naw just recently single! hahah  I guess I won't mention my new 46" HDTV with wireless surround sound either
Don't let the ex hear about any new found wealth...LOL  Nothing brings a dog back into the bushes with her nose on the ground than the smell of money.
no matter how warm it is-DON'T dip feet in the water
Stoty, check out Scott Martin's site as I think it's his home lake so there may be tips there...  just guessing though...
Live Golden Shiner fishin' is the way to go for the big boys!!!  Artificials won't catch much over 3 lbs.... unless you hook a Alligator on a buzzbait!
I almost lost my noodles on that one
Just wondering out of curiosity, With or without Bobber.  Seen one of the shows where they used a Ballon.
I'm living vicariously through you Stoty. Have an awesome time man!

I remember watching a couple TC shows of doing SHINER FISHING at Lake Okeechobee...and as HOLDFAST mentioned, they were using BALLOONS as their bobbers...? Hope you have fun!! Report back to us with pics... I heard there are PIGS in that lake!

Ya, I've done the whole live shiner thing, but this time, my buddy and I are going with only artificials.    P.S - Let's just say that my (soon to be) ex-wife, has A LOT more to lose than I do! So...if she wants to play hardball...so be it! I will end up with a 21ft Ranger, brand new SUV and my own house!
I'd go with BIG plastics then, 12" plastic worms and 8-10" plastic lizards!
Both of which, I do not have living in Ontario! haha Thanks GDC, I'll have to keep my eyes open at the Spring Fishing Show in a few week!
